div.head: An Abſtract of the caſe of Lawrence Lownes Eſquire, Concerning the Mannors of Hutton, Wandiſley, and Angram, with advowſon of the Church of Hutton, in the County of the City of Yorke, as it reſteth vpon the proofes.
div.p: Peter Bland of London Eſquire, was ſeized of, and in the Mannors and advowſon afore-ſayd, in his demeaſne as of Fee, and being ſo thereof ſeized according to a deliberate agreement betwixt him, and the ſayd Lawrence Lownes vpon accompts made betwixt them, and due conſideration of his the ſayd Peters eſtate, did giue and deliuer vnto the ſayd Lawrence Lownes bonds, and ſpecialties, amounting to 1150 l'. and by his deede indented, bearing date the 12. of Nouem. 22. Iacob. Reg. ſealed and deliuered before many ſufficient witneſſes without exception, and acknowledged before Sr. Iames Huſse one of the Maiſters of the Chancery, and there duly inrolled, did bargaine, and ſell, the ſayd Mannors and premiſes, vnto the ſaid Lawrence Lownes, and vnto Iames Milles, and Ioliffe Lownes, and their heires for euer; yet in truſt onely for the ſaid Lawrence Lownes and his heires.

And afterwards, the ſayd Peter Bland 24. Nouem. 22. Iacob. by his other deede indented, ſealed, and deliuered before many likewitneſſes, and likewiſe acknowledged before the ſayd Maſter of the Chancery, and there duly inrolled, did further bargaine, and ſell, aſſure, releaſe, and confirme the ſayd Mannors and premiſſes, to the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, Iames Milles, and Iolliffe Lownes, and their heires, in truſt, as afore-ſayd, with a couenant for aſſurances of the premiſſes.

And afterwards, for further aſſurance according to his couenant, 27. Iunij, 1. Caroli, the ſayd Peter Bland acknowledged a fine of the ſayd Mannors and premiſſes before a Serieant at Law, in the preſence of many perſons of good worth, quality, and credit, which by his Indenture ſealed and deliuered before many like witneſſes, dated 26. Iunij, 1. Caroli, was declared to be to the former vſes.

div.head: The reaſons and conſiderations inducing the ſayd Peter Bland, to make the ſayd aſsurances of the ſaid Mannors and premiſses, and diſpoſall of ſpecialties for the ſaid 1150. l'. to the ſaid Lawrence Lownes.

list.head: 1. Valuable Conſiderations.
list.item: 1. 340 l'. in hand payd by the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, to the ſayd Peter Bland.
2. 310 l'. per annum, to be payd vnto the ſayd Bland during his life, by the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, the ſayd land being worth, and let for 216 l'. per annum, and no more.

3. 50 l'. to be payd after the ſayd Peter Blands death yearely, by the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, to Mrs. Ioane Langhorne, one of the ſayd Blands Daughters during her life, ſhe being a healthy woman, not yet exceeding forty yeares of age.

4. The ſayd Lawrence Lownes, is by appointment of the ſayd Peter Bland to pay at ſeuerall dayes after the ſayd Blands death 2509 l' 3 s'. 4d'. to ſeuerall perſons, being children, grand-children, and others neere of kin, vnto the ſayd Peter Bland.
1. For theſe Executory payments, the ſayd Lawrence Lownes gaue ſecurity by Indenture of couenants, and bonds of 4000 l'.
2. The Lands not worth aboue 3000 l'. to be ſold.

list.head: Conſiderations of loue, &c.
list.item: 1. For that the ſayd Lawrence Lownes had formerly at the inſtance of the ſaid Peter Bland, married his the ſaid Blands neece, whom the ſayd Bland had brought vp from her infancy, and was alſo eſteemed by him as his daughter.
2. For that the ſayd Lawrence Lownes had beene for a long time a carefull and faithfull dealer, and preſeruer of and for the ſaid Blands eſtate, which was very trouble-ſome and perplexed.

3. That the ſayd Peter Bland loued the ſayd Lawrence Lownes very tenderly, had an eſpeciall opinion of him grounded vppon ſufficient trials, and deſired therefore ſome way to ingage him the more, not for himſelfe onely during his life, but afterwards with the care and managing of the eſtates of his grand-children.

div.p: It is fully and directly prooued by many Witneſſes of credit without all manner of exception, that at and during the making and perfecting of thoſe conueyances and aſſurances, (being almoſt eight moneths in doing) as alſo before and after the ſayd Peter Bland was of an able diſpoſing memory, and vnderſtanding, and that at ſundry times, and before perſons of great credit, he voluntarily expreſſed his hearty loue to the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, with wiſhes that the before bargained premiſſes had beene more worth, and that he the ſayd Peter Bland had beene of better abilitie, to doe him, the ſayd Lawrence Lownes more good in requitall of his great loue and paines.

This bargaine was ratified and allowed of by the ſayd Peter Bland, by ſubſequent Acts during all his life after.
1. In his the ſayd Peter Bland receiuing the ſayd 310 l'. per annum during his life, being about two yeares after according to the ſaid bargaine by quarterly payments, as appeareth by eight ſeuerall acquittances, vnder his hand and ſeale proued.
2 Beſides the before mentioned Acts and conueyances) the ſayd Peter Bland by his laſt Will and Teſtament in Writing, made and Publiſhed the 27. of Iune, 1. Reg. Caroli, made a principall relation vnto the ſayd bargaine, and made thereof the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, and his brother Iohn Bland his Executors, and liued a yeare and a halfe after, ſtill continuing his the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, Executorſhip, in ſigne alſo of his conſtant loue and opinion of him, and approbation of the ſayd bargaine.

The premiſses conſidered the ſaid Lawrence Lownes hopes that it appeares that
1. This was no great benefit vnto the ſayd Lawrence Lownes.
2. No preiudice but aduantage to the ſayd Peter Bland in his owne particular.
3. The ſayd Peter Bland might the better doe thus, hauing no Sonnes.
4. Little or no preiudice came hereby to his Children, grand-children, and other kindred, among whom beſides his former chargeable preferments of his Daughters in marriage; and the ſayd 50 l'. per annum to his Daughter Langhorne, he did by and vpon the ſayd bargayne diſpoſe the ſayd whole 2509 l', 3 s'. 4 d'. beſides the reſt of his eſtate, to and among them alſo being about 6000 l'. albeit amongſt them there were not wanting ſome iuſt cauſes of Peter Blands diſpleaſure towards them.

The ſole obiections agaynſt the ſayd bargayne and aſſurances are, that all the benefits thereby redounding vnto the ſayd Lawrence Lownes was corruptly, by circumuention, and without iuſt conſideration drawne by the ſayd Lawrence Lownes, from the ſayd Peter Bland in his weakeneſſe; and therefore in the Court of Chancery, decreed agaynſt him the ſayd Lawrence Lownes onely, albeit the ſayd Court would not declare, that the ſayd Peter Bland was at the making of the aſſurances, or of the ſayd Will De non ſane memory, or that he was not of a diſpoſing memory, nor would make voyd the ſayd Conueyances, or Will, or diſaduantage any whom they concerned, but the ſayd Lawrence Lownes onely, as by the decree of the ſayd Court made Septimo die Februarij Anno Regni Regis Caroli, tertio: Inter Arnoldum Harbert mil. & al. querend, Lawrencium Lownes & al. defend. whereto for more truth and certayne relation bee had, it may appeare.The poſt ſcript is to come in at this place.

To this as concerning all matter of ſuppoſed corrupt dealing, circumuention, or want of iuſt conſideration, being matters which trench vpon the ſayd Lownes his reputation aſwell as profit, hee with all due reuerence Humbly offers the contrary; and that as hee hopeth vpon moſt iuſt grounds and reaſons, humbly deſiring the proofes may be conſidered, and the cauſe examined.

p.add: Lawrence Lownes hath been in priſon in the Fleet cloſe priſoner 3 yeares for nonꝑformanc • of the ſayd decree, and without any good ground sentenced▪ fyned v s in the ſtarchamber for the obteining of the ſayd Conveiances from Peeter Bland & not freed of the ſayd impriſonment vntill he his wife and two Children being Infants by fine and recouery made aſsuraunce of the ſayd Mannor and lands vnto vs according to the compulſion of ye ſayd decree in Chauncerye
